conclusion: Objects A and B are released and move through the air due to gravity, coming into contact with objects C, D, E, and F.
Object A is a cloth with a checkered pattern, and object B is a cloth with a solid dark color.
Objects C and D are vertical blue blocks located on the left-hand side of the table.
Objects E and F are vertical blocks with green and yellow colors located on the right-hand side of the table.
When released, objects A and B drop under gravity and collide with the vertical blocks C, D, E, and F.
The cloth labelled A settles over the two blue blocks (C and D) on the left-hand side of the table.
The cloth labelled B settles over the green–yellow pair of blocks (E and F) on the right-hand side of the table.
Nothing tips over or breaks—the blocks stay upright.
The two cloths hang in stable 'tent-like' shapes that conform to the outlines of the blocks beneath them.
